survey_brief: This survey aims to understand traveler preferences and decision-making factors when choosing vacation destinations.

questions.question_text: When planning a vacation, which of the following factors is most important to you?
questions.client_notes: Recommend using a forced-choice single selection to identify primary decision drivers
questions.scripter_notes: Field type: radio button, single selection required

script.question_text: When planning a vacation, which of the following factors is most important to you?

questions.question_text: Which types of accommodations do you typically prefer when traveling? (Select all that apply)
questions.client_notes: Consider limiting selections to 3 options if analyzing for patterns
questions.scripter_notes: Field type: checkbox, multiple selections allowed

script.question_text: Which types of accommodations do you typically prefer when traveling? (Select all that apply)

questions.question_text: What percentage of your annual income do you allocate to travel?
questions.client_notes: Use percentage ranges rather than exact figures for better response rates
questions.scripter_notes: Field type: radio button with vertical layout

script.question_text: What percentage of your annual income do you allocate to travel?

questions.question_text: Describe your ideal vacation in 2-3 sentences.
questions.client_notes: Keep open-ended questions to minimum for better completion rates
questions.scripter_notes: Field type: text area with 250 character limit

script.question_text: Describe your ideal vacation in 2-3 sentences.

questions.question_text: How many international trips do you typically take per year?
questions.routing_logic: All respondents except those who selected 'None' in Q3
questions.client_notes: Consider adding a follow-up question about domestic trips if budget allows
questions.scripter_notes: Field type: radio button with horizontal layout

script.question_text: How many international trips do you typically take per year?
script.routing_logic: All respondents except those who selected 'None' in Q3
